clinical_study.brief_title: Isolated Anti-HBc Serological Profile in HIV Infected Patients: Immunological, Virological Characteristics and Response to Hepatitis B Vaccination
clinical_study.official_title: Study of Immunological, Virological, Serological Characteristics of HIV+ Patients Harboring Isolated Anti-HBc Profile and Response to Hepatitis B Vaccination

lead_sponsor.agency: French National Institute for Health and Medical Research-French National Agency for Research on AIDS and Viral Hepatitis (Inserm-ANRS)

clinical_study.source: French National Institute for Health and Medical Research-French National Agency for Research on AIDS and Viral Hepatitis (Inserm-ANRS)

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of study is to describe the clinical, immunological, serological, virological and therapeutic characteristics of HIV+ patients harboring isolated anti-HBc profile and to assess the response to vaccination in these patients.

primary_outcome.measure: Evaluation of immunological, virological and serological characteristics associated to "anti-HBc isolated" profile

primary_outcome.time_frame: at 4 weeks, 28 weeks and 18 months after the first vaccination HBV

primary_outcome.measure: Analysis of B-cell phenotype and maturation

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of patients with HBsAb titers as protective titer>10 IU/L
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at 4 weeks,28 weeks and 18 month after the first dose HBV vaccin

secondary_outcome.measure: Detection of IgG+ memory B cells specific for HBcAg or HBs Ag
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at baseline and 28 weeks after the first dose HBV vaccin

secondary_outcome.measure: - Detection of HBV preS2 and S-specific T cells

study_pop.textblock: Patients with HIV infection and presenting with "isolated anti-HBc" profile. HBV vaccination is recommended fot these patients.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- HIV+ adults patients
- negative HBsAg
- negative a-HBs Ab
- positive HBc Ab
- without HBV - vaccination
- CD4 cell above 200 /mm3
- HIV viral load below 50 copies/mL
Exclusion Criteria:
- positive HBs antigenemia in the past
- transaminitis above fivefold upper normal limit
- PT<50% or Platelet <50 000/mm3
- ongoing opportunistic infection
- ongoing or recent systemic corticoid or immunomodulatory therapy, splenectomy, pregnancy, contra-indication to intramuscular injection, familial history of neurological disease.
